Package mmj.gmff

Class GMFFExporter

java.lang.Object
mmj.gmff.GMFFExporter
Direct Known Subclasses:
ModelAExporter
public abstract class GMFFExporter extends Object
GMFFExporter is the base class for creating export files.

There can be multiple Exporters in use at one time but the key is Export Type (e.g. "html", "althtml", etc.) and only one Exporter of a given Export Type can be active at one time.

The Export Type key is used to bring together and consolidate the various RunParm settings at GMFF initialization time.

What this all boils down to is that there cannot be two different Models in use for, say, Export Type "html" in a single execution of mmj2. However, the Export Type code is arbitrary and no functionality is hard-coded based on Export Type. So it is possible to define another Export Type such as "html2" which and use say, Model B, at the same time that Export Type "html" uses Model A -- you would just need to define all of the relevant parameters, including the Export Directory (so that the two exports don't overwrite each other.)

GMFFExporter also contains a Map holding a cache of Model Files -- modelFileCacheMap for the given Export Type. The purpose is to avoid re-reading the model files over and over again.

GMFFExporter also contains a number of utility functions which are common to the different model exporters, such as ModelAExporter, which is an extension of GMFFExporter.

  • Method Details

    • ConstructModelExporter

      public static GMFFExporter ConstructModelExporter(GMFFManager gmffManager, GMFFExportParms gmffExportParms, GMFFUserTextEscapes gmffUserTextEscapes) throws GMFFException
      A factory for generating GMFFExporters according to Model Id.

      Right now only Model A is defined, so this code looks peculiar.

      Note: The Exporter's gmffExporterTypesetDefs are loaded at GMFFInitialize time, and are left null when the Exporter is initially constructed.

      Parameters:
      gmffManager - The GMFFManager instance.
      gmffExportParms - Export Parms for the output GMFFExporter
      gmffUserTextEscapes - Text Escapes for the output GMFFExporter
      Returns:
      the newly created GMFFExporter
      Throws:
      GMFFException - if an error occurred

    • exportProofWorksheet

      public abstract GMFFException exportProofWorksheet(ProofWorksheetCache proofWorksheetCache, String appendFileName)
      Abstract method to export a Proof Worksheet according to the pattern of a Model.
      Parameters:
      proofWorksheetCache - ProofWorksheetCache object containing the proof to be exported.
      appendFileName - File Name (minus File Type) of append file if the regular file name is to be overridden (see documentation of appendFileNames in GMFFDoc\GMFFRunParms.txt).
      Returns:
      Confirmation message of the successful export showing the absolute path of the output file -- or null if the export failed (error messages are accumed in the Messages object.)

    • appendMandatoryModelFile

      public void appendMandatoryModelFile(StringBuilder exportBuffer, String mandatoryModelFileName, String theoremLabel) throws GMFFException
      Outputs the contents of a Mandatory Model File to the export buffer throwing an exception if the file is not found.
      Parameters:
      exportBuffer - StringBuilder containing the contents of the export file.
      mandatoryModelFileName - the File Name of the Model File within the Models Directory for this Export Type.
      theoremLabel - provided for use in error messages.
      Throws:
      GMFFException - if other errors encountered (such as I/O errors.)

    • appendModelFileText

      public void appendModelFileText(StringBuilder exportBuffer, String modelFileText)
      Appends text from a Model File to the output StringBuilder.

      NOTE: does not escape the text because it is from a Model File and should already be escaped (as needed.)

      Parameters:
      exportBuffer - StringBuilder containing the contents of the export file.
      modelFileText - data from the Model File to be appended to the exportBuffer.

    • typesetAndAppendToken

      public void typesetAndAppendToken(StringBuilder exportBuffer, String token, String theoremLabel)
      If possible typesets the input token and outputs to the buffer.

        if token found in typesetting table, appends the replacement text from the table to the export buffer -- and returns. Otherwise...
      • if not found in the typesetting table then escapes it as text and appends it,
      • if the not-found token is a valid, non-WorkVar symbol then an error message is sent about the missing typesetting table entry.

      Note: In the situation where the image file (.gif) referenced by the typesetting replacement text is not present in the Export Directory, some browsers display "ALT=" text. The Metamath set.mm $t statement uses the "ALT=" feature to display the ASCII token text. So in this scenario it may appear that the token was not found in the typesetting table, but the absence of an error message indicates that that is not the case.

      Parameters:
      exportBuffer - StringBuilder containing the contents of the export file.
      token - the Metamath token to be typeset.
      theoremLabel - provided for use in error messages.

    • escapeAndAppendProofText

      public void escapeAndAppendProofText(StringBuilder exportBuffer, String proofText)
      Appends non-typeset text to the output buffer after escaping the text.
      Parameters:
      exportBuffer - StringBuilder containing the contents of the export file.
      proofText - output text from the proof worksheet to be escaped and appended to the output buffer.

    • getMandatoryModelFile

      public String getMandatoryModelFile(String mandatoryModelFileName, String theoremLabel) throws GMFFException
      Returns a String containing the contents of a mandatory Model File.

      Invokes the routine to read the Model File from the cache and if not found -- because it is a Mandatory Model File -- throws the GMFFMandatoryModelNotFoundException exception.

      Parameters:
      mandatoryModelFileName - the File Name of the Model File within the Models Directory for this Export Type.
      theoremLabel - provided for use in error messages.
      Returns:
      String containing the contents of the Model File.
      Throws:
      GMFFException - if other errors encountered (such as I/O errors.)

    • getOptionalModelFile

      public String getOptionalModelFile(String optionalModelFileName) throws GMFFException
      Returns a String containing the contents of an optional Model File.

      Invokes the routine to read the Model File from the cache and if not found -- because it is an Optional Model File -- simply returns null.

      Parameters:
      optionalModelFileName - the File Name of the Model File within the Models Directory for this Export Type.
      Returns:
      String containing the contents of the Model File.
      Throws:
      GMFFException - if an error occurred

    • readModelFile

      public String readModelFile(String modelFileName) throws GMFFException
      Returns the cached model file contents or if not cached already reads the model file from disk and caches it.

      Returns the file contents as a String, or throws an exception if not found.

      Parameters:
      modelFileName - the File Name of the Model File within the Models Directory for this Export Type.
      Returns:
      String containing the contents of the Model File.
      Throws:
      GMFFException - if other errors encountered (such as I/O errors.)

    • loadMinProofWorksheet

      protected void loadMinProofWorksheet(ProofWorksheetCache p) throws GMFFException
      Loads a MinProofWorksheet object using the cached proofText if the cache does not already contain a loaded instance of the MinProofWorksheet.
      Parameters:
      p - the ProofWorksheetCache object.
      Throws:
      GMFFException - if an error occurred

    • outputToExportFile

      protected GMFFException outputToExportFile(StringBuilder exportText, String appendFileName, String theoremLabel) throws GMFFException
      Writes the exported text to an output file.

      Note: the name of the output file is generated here and it is a bit tricky. There is a hierarchy of possibilities:

      • if appendFileName is not null then that is the name used, and the file is opened in "append mode", meaning the output is written to the end of the file if the file already exists.
      • otherwise, if the Export Parms specify an output file name then that is the name used.
      • otherwise, the theoremLabel is used as the file name.

      Finally, to note, the output file name's File Type is appended to the file name computed above, in every case.

      Parameters:
      exportText - the contents to be written out.
      appendFileName - File Name (minus File Type) of append file if the regular file name is to be overridden (see documentation of appendFileNames in GMFFDoc\GMFFRunParms.txt).
      theoremLabel - the label of the theorem whose proof is being exported.
      Returns:
      Confirmation message of the successful export showing the absolute path of the output file.
      Throws:
      GMFFException - if the output operation fails.

    • writeExportFile

      protected String writeExportFile(String exportFileName, StringBuilder exportBuffer, boolean append) throws GMFFException
      Writes the export text to the specified file and returns a String containing the absolute path of the output file.

      Note that here is where the last of the Export Parms come into play, including the Export Directory and the Charset Encoding name. Export Type is used in error messages, just to be helpful.

      The actual I/O operation is handled by GMFFExportfile.

      Parameters:
      exportFileName - the output file, including file type.
      exportBuffer - the output text data.
      append - true if file is to be opened in "append mode", otherwise false.
      Returns:
      String containing the absolute path of the export file.
      Throws:
      GMFFException - if the output operation fails.
